data.text:
In Rudolf Friml

Rose Marie (1924; book and lyrics by Harbach and Oscar Hammerstein II), best remembered for the song “Indian Love Call,” was followed in 1925 by The Vagabond King (book and lyrics by Brian Hooker and W.H. Post), with its popular songs “Only a Rose” and…

In theatre music: Viennese operetta

…by figures listing Rudolf Friml’s Rose Marie (1924) and Sigmund Romberg’s The Desert Song (1926) as the most frequently performed works in U.S. musical theatre, in terms of both amateur and professional performances.
